Question: Hi. how do I make the deep fried turkey? 
 Context: Ingredients: 3 gallons peanut oil for frying, or as needed, 1 (12 pound) whole turkey, neck and giblets removed, 1/4 cup Creole seasoning, 1 white onion, 
Directions: 0) In a large stockpot or turkey fryer, heat oil to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 1) Be sure to leave room for the turkey, or the oil will spill over. 2) Layer a large platter with food-safe paper bags. 3) Rinse turkey, and thoroughly pat dry with paper towels. 4) Rub Creole seasoning over turkey inside and out. 5) Make sure the hole at the neck is open at least 2 inches so the oil can flow freely through the bird. 6) Place the whole onion and turkey in drain basket. 7) The turkey should be placed in basket neck end first. 8) Slowly lower basket into hot oil to completely cover turkey. 9) Maintain the temperature of the oil at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and cook turkey for 3 1/2 minutes per pound, about 45 minutes. 10) Carefully remove basket from oil, and drain turkey. 11) Insert a meat thermometer into the thickest part of the thigh; the internal temperature must be 180 degrees F (80 degrees C). 12) Finish draining turkey on the prepared platter.
conv_answer: Do you have a large stockpot or turkey fryer?
target_answer: 0) In a large stockpot or turkey fryer, heat oil to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Question: Yes I'd like that! 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 tablespoon butter, softened, 1 egg white, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 1/2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 pinch salt, 1/2 (1 ounce) square unsweetened chocolate, grated, 1/3 cup confectioners' sugar for decoration, 
Directions: 0) Preheat an oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). 1) Grease cookie sheets. 2) In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter till lightly browned. 3) Pour into medium sized bowl. 4) Stir in the egg white, sugar and vanilla. 5) Combine the flour cocoa, and salt; mix into the butter mixture. 6) Fold in chocolate. 7) Drop by teaspoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto cookie sheets. 8) Bake for 12 to 15 minutes. 9) Transfer to rack to cool and dust with confectioners' sugar.
conv_answer: The first two ingredients are 1 tablespoon butter, softened and 1 egg white.

input:
Question: Yes, please! 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 pound ground pork, 4 cups shredded cabbage, 1 large carrot, shredded, 1/2 green bell pepper, cut into thin strips, 1 medium onion, chopped, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 3 teaspoons fresh ginger root, grated, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 1/2 tablespoons molasses, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 quart oil for frying, 1 1/2 (14 ounce) packages egg roll wrappers, 1 1/2 cups sweet and sour sauce, 
Directions: 0) Cook pork in a large wok over medium-high heat. 1) Drain and set aside. 2) In a large bowl, mix the cabbage, carrot, green bell pepper, onion, garlic and ginger. 3) In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch, soy sauce, and molasses until smooth. 4) Heat 2 tablespoons oil in wok. 5) Stir in cabbage mixture in batches, cooking each batch 3 to 4 minutes, just until tender. 6) Return vegetables to bowl, and mix in pork. 7) Stir in the cornstarch mixture. 8) Heat 1 quart oil in a deep fryer to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C). 9) Place about 1 tablespoon filling on each egg roll wrapper. 10) Fold one corner of wrapper over filling. 11) Fold wrapper sides over filling. 12) Roll wrappers to form egg rolls. 13) Fry egg rolls in batches in the hot oil until golden brown. 14) Drain on paper towels and serve with sweet and sour sauce.
conv_answer: Ok, the first ingredients are 1 pound ground pork, 4 cups shredded cabbage and 1 large carrot, shredded.

Question: Chicken soup. How should I start? 
 Context: Ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 skinless chicken leg quarters, 1/2 cup chopped onion, 2 quarts water, 3 cubes  chicken bouillon, crumbled, 1 stalk celery, chopped, 3 carrots, chopped, 1 clove roasted garlic, minced, salt and pepper to taste, 1 (12 ounce) package thin egg noodles, 
Directions: 0) In a large pot over medium heat, cook chicken pieces in oil until browned on both sides. 1) Stir in onion and cook 2 minutes more. 2) Pour in water and chicken bouillon and bring to a boil. 3) Reduce heat and simmer 45 minutes. 4) Stir in celery, carrots, garlic, salt and pepper. 5) Simmer until carrots are just tender. 6) Remove chicken pieces and pull the meat from the bone. 7) Stir the noodles into the pot and cook until tender, 10 minutes. 8) Return chicken meat to pot just before serving.
conv_answer: Start by heating 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil over medium heat in a large pot.

Directions: 0) In a large bowl, cream together the butter, 1 1/3 cups sugar, and chai tea mix until light and fluffy. 1) Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each. 2) Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt; blend into the creamed mixture until all of the dry has been absorbed. 3) Cover the dough, and refrigerate for 1 hour. 4) Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 5) Roll the cookie dough into walnut sized balls, and roll the balls in sugar. 6) Place the cookies onto greased cookie sheets about 3 inches apart, and flatten slightly using the tines of a fork. 7) Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, just until the edges begin to brown. 8) Remove from cookie sheets to cool on wire racks.

Directions: 0) In a 1 pint glass jar or larger, combine the garlic, ginger, olive oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, honey, and water. 1) Cover the jar with a tight fitting lid, and shake well. 2) Remove lid, and heat jar in the microwave for 1 minute just to dissolve the honey. 3) Let cool, and shake well before serving. 4) Store covered in the refrigerator.
conv_answer: Hi. first take a pint glass. It could also be a pint jar or larger.

Question: Yes. how should I start? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 cup butter, 1 cup white sugar, 1 egg, 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 2 1/2 cups sifted all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 cup rolled oats, 1/4 teaspoon peppermint extract, 3 drops red food coloring, 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar, 5 (1.5 ounce) bars milk chocolate candy, 
Directions: 0) In a medium bowl, cream together butter or margarine and white sugar until light and fluffy. 1) Blend in egg and vanilla. 2) Sift together flour and salt. 3) Add to creamed mixture and mix well. 4) Stir in oats. 5) Divide dough in half. 6) Add peppermint extract and a few drops of food color to half of dough. 7) Chill for several hours. 8) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 9) Roll out each half of dough to 1/8 inch thickness on surface sprinkled lightly with confectioners' sugar. 10) Cut out half of each color with the 2 1/2 inch heart shaped cookie cutter, and half with a 1 1/2 inch cookie cutter. 11) Place them on unprepared cookie sheets. 12) Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. 13) Remove from oven and place 1 one square (1/8) of a chocolate bar onto the center of each large heart. 14) Place small heart on top and press lightly to secure. 15) Transfer to rack to cool.
conv_answer: Great. take a medium bowl and combine 1 cup butter and 1 cup white sugar until it looks light and fluffy.

 Context: Ingredients: 3 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 3 apples - peeled, cored and sliced, 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 1/4 cups vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup chopped walnuts, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan. 2) Sift together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. 3) Combine the apples and the white sugar; set aside. 4) In a large bowl, mix together the brown sugar, oil, eggs and vanilla. 5) Stir in the apple mixture, then the flour mixture. 6) Fold in the walnuts. 7) Pour batter into prepared pan. 8) Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. 9) Allow to cool.
conv_answer: The first two are 3 cups of all-purpose flour and 1 teaspoon baking soda. There are 11 ingredients.

 Context: Ingredients: 3 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 3 apples - peeled, cored and sliced, 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 1/4 cups vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup chopped walnuts, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan. 2) Sift together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. 3) Combine the apples and the white sugar; set aside. 4) In a large bowl, mix together the brown sugar, oil, eggs and vanilla. 5) Stir in the apple mixture, then the flour mixture. 6) Fold in the walnuts. 7) Pour batter into prepared pan. 8) Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. 9) Allow to cool.
conv_answer: You will also need brown sugar later. Next two ingredients are 1 cup brown sugar and one and one fourth of a  cup of vegetable oil.

Question: Sounds cool! How should I start? 
 Context: Ingredients: 2 cups pineapple juice, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 2 tablespoons light soy sauce (50% less sodium), 1 1/2 tablespoons white vinegar, 2 garlic cloves, crushed, 3 tablespoons minced fresh ginger, 1 1/4 pounds raw firm fish, such as salmon, tuna or halibut, cut in chunks, 4 cups fresh pineapple in large chunks (or substitute canned pineapple chunks), 1 large red onion, cut in wedges, 
Directions: 0) In a small saucepan, dissolve cornstarch in pineapple juice. 1) Add soy sauce, vinegar, garlic and ginger. 2) Simmer until slightly thickened, about 7 minutes. 3) Let cool. 4) Add fish and pineapple to sauce and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. 5) Thread fish, pineapple and onion on skewers. 6) Place on a hot grill (or under a broiler) until fish is done to your liking. 7) Serve with rice.
conv_answer: We can start with preparing the ingredients! The first two are 2 cups pineapple juice and 1 tablespoon cornstarch.

predictions: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
input:
Question: Yes please! 
 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon light brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 1/2 tablespoons ice water, 1 cup skim milk, 3 egg whites, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 bananas, peeled and sliced, 1 kiwi, peeled and sliced, 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries, 
Directions: 0) In a bowl, sift together the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. 1) Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 2) Sprinkle with the ice water, and toss the mixture with a fork until evenly moistened. 3) Pat into a round, and wrap in plastic. 4) Refrigerate for 30 minutes. 5) In the top half of a double boiler, heat the milk until it begins to bubble. 6) In a bowl, beat together the egg whites, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of the hot milk. 7) Whisk the egg white mixture into the remaining hot milk. 8) Cook and stir without boiling about 10 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. 9) Remove from heat, and stir in the vanilla. 10) Cool to room temperature. 11) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 12) Lightly grease an 8 inch tart pan with a removable bottom. 13) On a floured surface, roll the tart dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. 14) Press the chilled dough into the prepared tart pan. 15) Trim the edges, and pierce the bottom with a fork. 16) Bake 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. 17) Remove to a wire rack, and cool completely. 18) Spoon the filling mixture into the crust. 19) Bake 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. 20) Cool to room temperature on a wire rack. 21) Refrigerate 8 hours.
conv_answer: The first two ingredients are 1/2 cup all-purpose flour and 1 tablespoon light brown sugar.

Directions: 0) In a bowl, sift together the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. 1) Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 2) Sprinkle with the ice water, and toss the mixture with a fork until evenly moistened. 3) Pat into a round, and wrap in plastic. 4) Refrigerate for 30 minutes. 5) In the top half of a double boiler, heat the milk until it begins to bubble. 6) In a bowl, beat together the egg whites, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of the hot milk. 7) Whisk the egg white mixture into the remaining hot milk. 8) Cook and stir without boiling about 10 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. 9) Remove from heat, and stir in the vanilla. 10) Cool to room temperature. 11) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 12) Lightly grease an 8 inch tart pan with a removable bottom. 13) On a floured surface, roll the tart dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. 14) Press the chilled dough into the prepared tart pan. 15) Trim the edges, and pierce the bottom with a fork. 16) Bake 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. 17) Remove to a wire rack, and cool completely. 18) Spoon the filling mixture into the crust. 19) Bake 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. 20) Cool to room temperature on a wire rack. 21) Refrigerate 8 hours.
conv_answer: Finally refrigerate for 8 hours. I hope you enjoy your Banana Kiwi Strawberry Tart.

Question:  I'd like to prepare them first thank you. 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 (8 pound) bone-in shank ham, 4 cups water, or as needed, 1/2 cup honey, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 tablespoons liquid smoke flavoring, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 pinch ground cloves, 
Directions: 0) Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). 1) Place ham in a roasting pan. 2) Pour in water to a 2 inch depth. 3) Cover with a tight fitting lid. 4) Bake for 6 to 8 hours in the preheated oven (all day or all night). 5) Remove from the oven, pour off drippings and reserve. 6) Debone ham, removing any excess fat as well, and return to the roasting pan. 7) Skim fat from the top of the drippings, and discard. 8) In a small bowl, mix one cup of the drippings with honey, brown sugar, liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce and cloves. 9) Pour this over the ham, cover and return to the oven. 10) Remaining drippings may be discarded or reserved for other uses. 11) Bake for another 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. 12) Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
conv_answer: The first ingredients is very important: 1 (8 pound) bone-in shank ham 4 cups water, or as needed. The second ingredients is 4 cups water, or as needed.

Ok I removed bones and fat, is it time to serve it? 7) Skim fat from the top of the drippings, and discard. Ok I did that! what next? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 (8 pound) bone-in shank ham, 4 cups water, or as needed, 1/2 cup honey, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 tablespoons liquid smoke flavoring, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 pinch ground cloves, 
Directions: 0) Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). 1) Place ham in a roasting pan. 2) Pour in water to a 2 inch depth. 3) Cover with a tight fitting lid. 4) Bake for 6 to 8 hours in the preheated oven (all day or all night). 5) Remove from the oven, pour off drippings and reserve. 6) Debone ham, removing any excess fat as well, and return to the roasting pan. 7) Skim fat from the top of the drippings, and discard. 8) In a small bowl, mix one cup of the drippings with honey, brown sugar, liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce and cloves. 9) Pour this over the ham, cover and return to the oven. 10) Remaining drippings may be discarded or reserved for other uses. 11) Bake for another 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. 12) Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
conv_answer: Good now take a small bowl and mix one cup of the drippings with honey, brown sugar, liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce and cloves.
target_answer: 8) In a small bowl, mix one cup of the drippings with honey, brown sugar, liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce and cloves.

predictions: 9) Pour this over the ham, cover and return to the oven.

predictions: 1/2 cup butter
input:
Question: Yes I'd like that! 
 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup water, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 4 eggs, 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix, 2 1/2 cups cold milk, 1 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 3 tablespoons hot water, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 1) Grease a cookie sheet. 2) In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water. 3) Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely. 4) Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt. 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball. 6) Remove from heat. 7) Add eggs, one at a time, beating well to incorporate completely after each addition. 8) With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No. 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips. 9) Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and bake 20 minutes more, until hollow sounding when lightly tapped on the bottom. 10) Cool completely on a wire rack. 11) For the filling, combine pudding mix and milk in medium bowl according to package directions. 12) In a separate bowl, beat the cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. 13) Beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 14) Fold whipped cream into pudding. 15) Cut tops off of cooled pastry shells with a sharp knife. 16) Fill shells with pudding mixture and replace tops. 17) For the icing, melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. 18) Stir in 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 19) Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency. 20) Remove from heat, cool slightly, and drizzle over filled eclairs. 21) Refrigerate until serving.
conv_answer: The first 3 ingredients are 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup water and 1 cup all-purpose flour.

What is the next step? 3) Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely. Ok. the butter is now melted, what should I do next? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup water, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 4 eggs, 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix, 2 1/2 cups cold milk, 1 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 3 tablespoons hot water, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 1) Grease a cookie sheet. 2) In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water. 3) Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely. 4) Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt. 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball. 6) Remove from heat. 7) Add eggs, one at a time, beating well to incorporate completely after each addition. 8) With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No. 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips. 9) Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and bake 20 minutes more, until hollow sounding when lightly tapped on the bottom. 10) Cool completely on a wire rack. 11) For the filling, combine pudding mix and milk in medium bowl according to package directions. 12) In a separate bowl, beat the cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. 13) Beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 14) Fold whipped cream into pudding. 15) Cut tops off of cooled pastry shells with a sharp knife. 16) Fill shells with pudding mixture and replace tops. 17) For the icing, melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. 18) Stir in 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 19) Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency. 20) Remove from heat, cool slightly, and drizzle over filled eclairs. 21) Refrigerate until serving.
conv_answer: Now reduce heat to low, and also add flour and salt.
target_answer: 4) Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt.

predictions: 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball.
labels: 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball.

 Context: Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup water, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 4 eggs, 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix, 2 1/2 cups cold milk, 1 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 3 tablespoons hot water, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 1) Grease a cookie sheet. 2) In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water. 3) Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely. 4) Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt. 5) Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball. 6) Remove from heat. 7) Add eggs, one at a time, beating well to incorporate completely after each addition. 8) With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No. 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips. 9) Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and bake 20 minutes more, until hollow sounding when lightly tapped on the bottom. 10) Cool completely on a wire rack. 11) For the filling, combine pudding mix and milk in medium bowl according to package directions. 12) In a separate bowl, beat the cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. 13) Beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 14) Fold whipped cream into pudding. 15) Cut tops off of cooled pastry shells with a sharp knife. 16) Fill shells with pudding mixture and replace tops. 17) For the icing, melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. 18) Stir in 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. 19) Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency. 20) Remove from heat, cool slightly, and drizzle over filled eclairs. 21) Refrigerate until serving.
conv_answer: No not yet. Finally refrigerate until serving. Afterwards, you can enjoy your eclairs.

Question: Yay! I am ready to start! Could you give me the ingredients first? 
 Context: Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dried black-eyed peas, soaked overnight, 1/3 cup chopped celery, with leaves, 1 1/2 cups shredded carrot, 3/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, 1/2 cup chopped white onion, 1/8 cup chopped fresh mint, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 oranges, juiced, 1/2 lemon, juiced, 1 garlic clove, pressed, 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon brown sugar, 
Directions: 0) Place the beans in a saucepan with enough water to cover them by one inch. 1) Bring beans to a slow boil. 2) Reduce heat to low, and simmer until tender but not mushy (about 35 minutes). 3) Set aside to cool. 4) When the beans have cooled, place them in a large bowl. 5) Add the celery, carrots, parsley, white onion, and mint; toss to blend. 6) For dressing, blend olive oil, orange and lemon juice, garlic, coriander, salt, pepper, and brown sugar in a blender for 6 seconds. 7) Transfer to a small saucepan, and simmer over low heat for five minutes. 8) Remove from heat, and cool. 9) Pour dressing over the bean salad, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
conv_answer: The first two ingredients are 1 1/2 cups dried black-eyed peas. They should be soaked overnight. And 1/3 cup chopped celery, with leaves.

Directions: 0) Place water, egg, bread flour, white sugar, powdered milk, salt, 5 tablespoons butter and yeast in bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer. 1) Select DOUGH setting, and turn machine on. 2) Meanwhile; in a small saucepan, melt 1/3 cup butter. 3) Add 1/2 cup brown sugar and ice cream; bring to a boil, and cook for 2 minutes. 4) Pour caramel into the bottom of a lightly greased 9 x 13 inch pan. 5) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 6) When machine has finished cycling remove dough from pan and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. 7) Pat dough into a rectangle. 8) Spread with softened butter and sprinkle lightly with cinnamon. 9) Crumble 1/2 cup brown sugar over the top. 10) Roll up, and seal edge. 11) Cut into 12 rolls, and place in prepared pan of caramel. 12) Allow to rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. 13) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.

 Context: Ingredients: 4 pounds boneless chuck roast, 2 cups water, 1 (1 ounce) package dry onion and mushroom soup mix, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, 3 potatoes, peeled and chopped, 2 stalks celery, chopped, 2 carrots, chopped, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Score roast on top and sides, and place in a medium sized oven bag. 2) Combine water, soup mix, and Worcestershire sauce; pour over roast. 3) Arrange vegetables around meat. 4) Place oven bag on a roasting pan. 5) Place roast in oven, and immediately reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). 6) Bake for 1 1/2 hours for medium well done, or adjust time for desired doneness.
conv_answer: First preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 175 degrees Celsius.

 Context: Ingredients: 2 1/2 tablespoons olive oil, 3 tablespoons plain yogurt, 2 tablespoons distilled white vinegar, 1 medium onion, sliced, 2 cloves garlic, crushed, 1 tablespoon ginger paste, 2 small green chile peppers, 2 medium tomatoes, chopped, 2 tablespoons garam masala, 1 tablespoon dried mint, salt and pepper to taste, 5 sprigs cilantro, 1 (3 pound) whole chicken, skin removed and cut into pieces, 2 quarts water, 4 cups uncooked basmati rice, 1 bay leaf, 4 pods green cardamom, 1 pod black cardamom, 1 cinnamon stick, salt to taste, 1/4 teaspoon powdered yellow food coloring, 
Directions: 0) Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 1) Mix in the yogurt and vinegar. 2) Place the onion in the skillet, and cook until tender. 3) Mix in the garlic, ginger paste, green chile peppers, and tomatoes. 4) Cook and stir until tomatoes are tender. 5) Season with garam masala, mint, salt, and pepper, and mix in the cilantro. 6) Place the chicken in the skillet. 7) Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and continue cooking 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until chicken juices run clear. 8) Bring the water and rice to a boil in a large pot. 9) Mix in the bay leaf, green cardamom, black cardamom, and cinnamon. 10) Season with salt to taste. 11) Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 20 minutes. 12) In a separate pot, alternate the rice and chicken mixture in layers, topping with rice. 13) Sprinkle with the food coloring, and mix to serve.
conv_answer: Now you can place the chicken in the skillet.

 Context: Ingredients: 1 pound chicken parts, 1 large onion, 3 stalks celery, including some leaves, 1 large carrot, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 3 whole cloves, 6 cups water, 1/4 cup cold water (optional), 1 egg, 
Directions: 0) Quarter onion. 1) Chop scrubbed celery and carrot into 1 inch chunks. 2) Place chicken pieces, onion, celery, carrot, salt, and cloves in large soup pot or Dutch oven. 3) Add 6 cups water. 4) Bring to a boil. 5) Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 1 hour. 6) Remove chicken and vegetables. 7) Strain stock. 8) Skim fat off the surface. 9) Separate the egg white from the egg yolk, and reserve the shell. 10) In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup cold water, egg white, and crushed eggshell. 11) Add to strained stock, and bring to a boil. 12) Remove from heat, and let stand 5 minutes. 13) Strain again through a sieve lined with cheesecloth.
conv_answer: The first two ingredients are 1 pound of chicken parts and 1 large onion.
